item.title: Jagex owes me 1 fire cape.. and 1 dragon defender
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Hash1 Single, post:36, topic:425334”]
I had nothing against you until you just said that to me. That sentence demonstrated your ignorance and/or general unawareness that even YOURSELF knows nothing about grammar.

Brb, I’m in honors English.

Please, for the love of god, learn proper grammar.

^ I added bold to things that you didn’t have/were incorrect. I also dropped ‘proper’ in front of grammar as there was no need for it.[/quote]

The day I see the word propaganda associated with Runescape players, Jagex, or the Youtube groupies is the day I commit suicide.

Troll mission completed LOLOLOOLOLLOOLLOLLO

Like how you remove your stupid ass messages when you’re wrong.

Congratulations, you have proven further how nobody seems to give a fuck about your petty issues or grammatical squabbles. You need a life outside the computer if you care so much about improperly correcting someone and saying you trolled them when you were logic'd.
/thread

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex owes me 1 fire cape.. and 1 dragon defender

item.title: Jagex owes me 1 fire cape.. and 1 dragon defender
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Hash1 Single, post:6, topic:425645”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=527998.msg3853155#msg3853155 date=1324175903]

Pretty sure you’re supposed to capitalize any nouns.

That is incorrect, as you are only supposed to capitalize proper nouns, which is the name of a person or place.

In case you don’t know what a noun is, it is a person, place, thing, or idea.

In case you don’t know who I am, I am one of the most ‘Grammar Nazi’ type people on this forum, so why don’t you stop making such underlying arrogant statements and come out with anything you have to say. God, to me, uses a lowercase “g”, because I see it as an idea, and not as a PROPER noun.
[/quote]

Troll mission completed LOLOLOOLOLLOOLLOLLO[/quote]Congratulations, you have proven further how nobody seems to give a fuck about your petty issues or grammatical squabbles. You need a life outside the computer if you care so much about improperly correcting someone and saying you trolled them when you were logic’d.

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex owes me 1 fire cape.. and 1 dragon defender

item.title: Jagex owes me 1 fire cape.. and 1 dragon defender
item.dc:creator: @Hash1_Single Hash1 Single
item.description:
@Hash1_Single wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:33, topic:425334”]Propaganda…?
safasfasfasfasfa[/quote]

Hash1 Single:

Propaganda is a form of communication that is aimed at influencing the attitude of a community toward some cause or position so as to benefit oneself or one’s group.

Different sites give different answers, this is the one that was more towards my idea. Propaganda is more about politics, but it still suited nicely into what I said

Andrew Ferguson:

Please, for the love of god learn proper grammar.

I had nothing against you until you just said that to me. That sentence demonstrated your ignorance and/or general unawareness that even YOURSELF knows nothing about grammar.

Brb, I’m in honors English.

Please, for the love of god, learn proper grammar.

^ I added bold to things that you didn’t have/were incorrect. I also dropped ‘proper’ in front of grammar as there was no need for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex owes me 1 fire cape.. and 1 dragon defender
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Hash1 Single, post:23, topic:425334”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=527998.msg3852146#msg3852146 date=1324105169]
Why do you keep posting pking videos here?
[/quote]

Propaganda

more views = more money[/quote]
Propaganda…?

[quote=" Dictionary.com"]1.
information, ideas, or rumors deliberately spread widely to help or harm a person, group, movement, institution, nation, etc.
2.
the deliberate spreading of such information, rumors, etc.
3.
the particular doctrines or principles propagated by an organization or movement.
4.
Roman Catholic Church .
a.
a committee of cardinals, established in 1622 by Pope Gregory XV, having supervision over foreign missions and the training of priests for these missions.
b.
a school (College of Propaganda) established by Pope Urban VIII for the education of priests for foreign missions.
5.
Archaic . an organization or movement for the spreading of propaganda.[/quote]

Read full topic
